div1.p: UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of Ernest Hutchinson for Writ of Habeas Corpus.

This cause coming to be heard on the 11th day of May, A.D., 1904, on the petition of Ernest Hutchinson for Writ of Habeas Corpus, and considering the stipulation filed and the briefs of petitioner and respondent and the evidence and the law in the case and considering the opinion of the Court filed herein and being now fully satisfied in the premises and for the reasons set forth in the said opinion;

It is hereby ordered, adjudged and decreed that subdivisions 1 and 2 of section 7 of Ordinance No. 6036 entitled "AN ORDINANCE to license and regulate certain trades and occupations in the City of Seattle, providing penalties for the violation thereof and repealing all ordinances inconsistent therewith."; passed by the City Cuncil of the City of Seattle on the 11th day of June, 1900, and approved by the Mayor of said city on the 14th day of June, 1900, be and the same is hereby decreed and adjudged to be void and of no effect and that the imprisonment of said petitioner thereunder is a deprivation of his liberty in violation of the 14th Amendment of the Constitution of the United States and the said petitioner is therefor discharged from custody without day.
It is further ordered and adjudged that the said respondent, the City of Seattle, pay the costs and disbursements of petitioner in this action.
Done in open Court Chambers at Seattle this 20th day of May, A.D., 1904.
To all of which respondent excepts which exception is allowed. Dated May 20th A.D., 1904.
No. 1183 United States Circuit Court District of Washington Northern Division
In the Matter of the Petition of Ernest Hutchinson for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court Dist. of Washington May 20, 1904 A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk A.N. Moore
